docs.snippet: Viktor Orban, the country’s prime minister, has been aggressive both politically and in the business world, and a new soccer stadium in his tiny hometown is testament to his rising ambitions....
docs.lead_paragraph: Viktor Orban, the country’s prime minister, has been aggressive both politically and in the business world, and a new soccer stadium in his tiny hometown is testament to his rising ambitions.
docs.abstract: Rising fortunes of Hungary's ambitious Prime Min Viktor Orban are symbolized in newly-constructed soccer stadium in his home town of Felcsut; since coming to power in 2010, Orban and his Fidesz party have rewritten the constitution and passed hundreds of laws, including a tax code that makes business investment in sports tax-deductible; Orban is expected to further consolidate his power in upcoming elections.

headline.main: A Village Stadium Is a Symbol of Power for Hungary’s Premier

docs.snippet: For those who grumble about their daily commute, imagine this ride to work: clamber into an elevator cage and plummet 2.4 kilometers (1.5 miles) into the earth, so fast that ears pop from the changing air pressure. Then board a small railroad car ...
docs.lead_paragraph: For those who grumble about their daily commute, imagine this ride to work: clamber into an elevator cage and plummet 2.4 kilometers (1.5 miles) into the earth, so fast that ears pop from the changing air pressure. Then board a small railroad car that creaks and grinds the same distance to the outer reaches of a South African gold mine.

headline.main: At South African Mine, It's a Long, Long Way Down
headline.print_headline: At South African Mine, It's a Long, Long Way Down
